meanings.definition: A tuft or clump of grass or vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The field was covered in tussucks of green grass.
meanings.sent2: She sat on a tussucks of soft moss to rest.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rolled around in the tussucks of dandelions.
meanings.sent4: The tussucks of wildflowers swayed in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The tussucks of clover added a splash of color to the meadow.

meanings.definition: A small hill or mound of earth.
meanings.sent1: The children ran up and down the tussucks in the park.
meanings.sent2: The tussucks provided a perfect spot for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked hard to build their nest under the tussucks.
meanings.sent4: The tussucks looked like tiny mountains against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The tussucks offered a great view of the surrounding landscape.

meanings.definition: To gather or form into tufts or clumps.
meanings.sent1: She tussucks the yarn together to make a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent2: The gardener tussucks the flowers for a beautiful arrangement.
meanings.sent3: The chef tussucks the herbs to add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent4: He tussucks the papers on his desk to organize them neatly.
meanings.sent5: The artist tussucks the paint to create a textured masterpiece.
